SENT.plain: A case of basilar artery occlusion is reported
The patient suddenly developed dizziness and weakness of the right side
Computed tomography scanning showed focal low attenuation in the left quadrangular lobule of the pons

Cerebral angiography demonstrated proximal occlusion of the basilar artery and significant collateral flow in the posterior fossa from the left posterior inferior cerebellar artery (PICA), which arose from the vertebral artery far below the foramen magnum
The literature concerning the origin of the PICA is reviewed
